meanings.definition: A person or thing that expunges.
meanings.sent1: The expunger quickly erased the incorrect information from the record.
meanings.sent2: The expunger at the office efficiently removed all the unnecessary files.
meanings.sent3: The expunger at the library had a magic wand to make mistakes disappear.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an expunger, wiping away all the sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The expunger's precision in deleting errors was truly impressive.

meanings.definition: To strike or blot out; erase; obliterate.
meanings.sent1: She used a cloth to expunger the spilled ink from the table.
meanings.sent2: The teacher needed to expunger the wrong answers on the test paper.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to expunger its paw prints from the wet paint.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to expunger all signs of life from the deserted island.
meanings.sent5: The eraser worked like an expunger, removing all traces of the mistake.

meanings.sent1: The rain helped expunger the footprints on the muddy path.
meanings.sent2: He wanted to expunger the memories of the embarrassing moment.
meanings.sent3: The robot's mission was to expunger any evidence of alien presence.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to expunger the pain of the past, leaving only faint scars.
meanings.sent5: Her laughter had the power to expunger all worries from his mind.
